item.title: Lean Green Belt Certification - register by 1/16 for discount
item.description: At the end of this month the Industrial Engineering Student Chapter will host the Lean Green Belt certification taught by MANE professor and Master Black Belt Dr. Ashish Ghosh! Lean Green Belt is a 3-day intensive course about Lean manufacturing, waste management, and engineering management. Any student is welcome to sign up! For a discounted price register by this Friday 1/16/26. Registration is open until the week of the course.

item.title: RPIRates Monthly Meeting - R Micro-bootcamp: Getting Started with R & RStudio!” | Jan. 21
item.description: RPI R users are invited to the January meeting of RPIrates: The RPI R Users Group! Our topic for Weds, 21 Jan (6p, AE217) will be “Getting Started with R and RStudio!” led by Dr. John S. Erickson, DirResOps for the Rensselaer FOCI. This special session is designed for anyone who is new to R. We’ll review the R Studio IDE, R syntax, and R’s basic data structures; provide helpful tips for troubleshooting your code; and point to helpful tutorials and other resources that will lead to R success!

item.description: Date: Thursday, January 22, 2026 6:00 PM - 7:00 PM - Join ASCE members for the first meeting of the semester. item.description: A variety of parking permit options are available to meet the needs of students, faculty, and staff. item.title: Radical Imagination: Person-Centric Approaches to Music Making
item.description: Prize-winning composer, improviser, and multi-instrumentalist Nick Dunston brings his multiple musical talents to RPI on January 22 with a presentation on “Radical Imagination,” drawing on his prolific body of work spanning jazz, electro-acoustics, and sound art. Dunston views improvisation not merely as a skill, but as a practice that fundamentally shapes the artists who engage in it. Join at 7pm at West Hall 326.

item.title: Annual State Fire Inspections Begin January 13
item.description: The New York State Office of Fire Prevention and Control (OFPC) conducts annual building inspections of all colleges and universities in New York State. This year, inspections of RPI’s academic and administrative buildings will begin on January 13 and are expected to take approximately six to seven weeks.

item.title: Webex Application Training Session on Friday January 23, 2026
item.description: Join us on Friday, January 23, from 11am-12pm for a hands-on Webex Training Session, part of the MMS Collaboration Software Training series. This session focuses on the Webex application and its integration with Outlook and Blackboard, so you can efficiently schedule, launch, and manage meetings directly from the tools you use every day. item.title: Teaching and Learning Collaboratory Faculty Call for Proposals: Submissions due March 9, 2026
item.description: The OUE and the TLC invites proposals from full time tenure track faculty members or lecturers/Professors of Practice for piloting and assessing pedagogical innovations, especially those integrating interactive technologies into the classroom. We wish to fund seed projects that will serve as the foundation for external grant applications. Project proposals should entail the implementation of new interactive approaches, gaming, remote laboratories, or other innovative methods.

item.title: Faculty and Staff Webinar: Tips for Incorporating Digital Story Telling as Assignments
item.description: Date: Tuesday, January 27, 2026 12:00 PM - 12:30 PM - In this quick learn webinar, we will discuss a high overview of the meaning of digital story telling, advantages, story telling assignment practices, and review the Six-Word Story, Six Unique Shots assignment concept. Maureen Fodera (Office of Undergraduate Education) will be presenting this workshop. Please register using the Event URL in the See section of the calendar event.

item.title: Faculty Staff Appreciation Lunch January 21st
item.description:
We’re excited to celebrate you! Please join us for a Faculty and Staff Appreciation Lunch on January 21 as a small thank-you for everything you do to support our campus community. On this special day, faculty and staff are invited to enjoy lunch for just $6 plus tax at Commons and Russell Sage Dining Halls.
